'''Remastersys''' is a script for [[Linux]] [[Linux distribution|distributions]] that allows a person to:
  +
1. Create a customized Live CD of Klikit-Linux, Ubuntu and derivatives.
  +
2. Backup all the system, including user data to a installable [[livecd|Live CD]].
  +   +
It was initially created to be able to easily backup or create a distributable copy of an Ubuntu or derivative installation. Inspiration for this tool came from the [[mklivecd]] script that Mandriva uses and the remasterme script that is in [[PCLinuxOS]]. Since those scripts are were not easy to port to ubuntu (it wasn't compatible with casper and ubiquity and used too many Mandriva specific things), it was created from scratch.
  +
<br> <br> It is very useful to create a customized Live CD version of Ubuntu, one just as to install ubuntu, install all the programs needed, including codecs, etc... install updates (recommended), and then install and run the script to create a Live CD with much more functionality than a original Ubuntu Live CD, the resulting iso can also the later installed in a USB pendrive <ref>http://www.pendrivelinux.com/2007/09/28/usb-ubuntu-710-gutsy-gibbon-install/</ref>.
  +   +
It currently works with [[Ubuntu_%28Linux_distribution%29|Ubuntu]], [[Linux_Mint|Linux Mint]] and Klikit, and possibly more distributions.
  +   +
